metadata.name: Yana
metadata.description:
Yana, 25 years old. Before Russian aggression lived in Kharkiv.

..."The next day I only had 10 minutes to run home and pack. Then everything is like a fogâ€¦ A train station, a million frightened people, tears, despair, fear, because the Russian bombs explode about one kilometer away from you again, evacuation, a train that we could not physically get into, you run back to the car and under shells and explosions you leave the city at your own risk"...

You can read her full [thrilling first-person story of horror](https://julartheart.com/ukrainian-refugees) resulted from Russian aggression at JulArtHeart.com
